results.title: Judging people
results.creator_credit: Roundtable Productions, Leon S. Gold and Arthur Swerdloff
results.brief_description: Shows frequent pitfalls in sizing up people, as well as methods of avoiding mistakes in making decisions about people, and predicting their performance. Tells how to improve one’s ability to analyze and judge personality, intelligence, ability and capacity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roundtable Productions, Leon S. Gold and Arthur Swerdloff
results.description: Shows frequent pitfalls in sizing up people, as well as methods of avoiding mistakes in making decisions about people, and predicting their performance. Tells how to improve one’s ability to analyze and judge personality, intelligence, ability and capacity.

results.title: Judgement and decision making
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
How do we make decisions? What effect does the group have on our judgment? What mistakes do we commonly make in negotiation? Every day of our lives we make decisions, and generally we feel that we are good at it. However real life experience and psychological experiment has shown that we often make decisions in a totally irrational manner. Philip Zimbardo, with the help of experts in the field, explores the psychology of decision making, reason and negotiation.

results.title: Judge Dredd for ZX Spectrum 48/128
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover, manual and plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Judge Dredd [computer game]. Judge Dredd is a single player action platformer. Players move Dredd to locations of crime as they appear on the sector map and select the crime they wish to pass judgement on. Once a crime has been selected, Dredd is dropped into a side scrolling platformer where both perps and civilians roam. Each crime is given an appropriate response level of Halt, Warn and Kill, though it is up to player discretion to change the response level. Depending on the response level is the action Dredd can perform, either shouting halt, firing warning shots or firing real bullets. Dredd can select a type of bullet from normal, armour piercing, incendiary, ricochet, high explosive and heat seeking.

results.title: Judex (English Version)
results.creator_credit: Comptoir Francais du Film Production (CFFP) and Georges Franju
results.brief_description:
Judex’ is a homage to Louis Feuillade’s twelve episode serial made in 1916. The characters - the evil banker, his innocent daughter, Judex the invisible avenger, the comic detective, the adventuress and the beautiful acrobat - are derived directly from the serial and full of improbable twists and turns. The magical clash between good and evil provides the pretext for poetic symbolism and surreal set pieces such as the murder at the masked ball, filmed in the contrasty black and white photography of early cinema. On the surface Franju’s film seems to foreshadow postmodern pastiche but the difference lies in the gap between the random stylistic allusion of the latter and Franju’s loving immersion in the ‘surreal innocence’ of an earlier time. ‘Judex’ will be a physical film, not a psychological film. Forget fiction. I want to make a dream-like, purely formal film; I am looking for a certain ceremonial, a certain luxury.” (Georges Franju). Also available in French on 16mm film.

Credits: Director, Georges Franju ; writers, Jacques Champreux, Francis Lacassin ; photography, Marcel Fradetal ; music, Maurice Jarre ; editor, Gilbert Natot.
Cast: Channing Pollock, Francine Berge, Sylvia Koscina, Edith Scob, Michel Vitold.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Comptoir Francais du Film Production (CFFP) and Georges Franju
results.description:

The characters - the evil banker, his innocent daughter, Judex the invisible avenger, the comic detective, the adventuress and the beautiful acrobat - are derived directly from the serial and full of improbable twists and turns. The magical clash between good and evil provides the pretext for poetic symbolism and surreal set pieces such as the murder at the masked ball, filmed in the contrasty black and white photography of early cinema. On the surface Franju’s film seems to foreshadow postmodern pastiche but the difference lies in the gap between the random stylistic allusion of the latter and Franju’s loving immersion in the ‘surreal innocence’ of an earlier time. ‘Judex’ will be a physical film, not a psychological film. Forget fiction. I want to make a dream-like, purely formal film; I am looking for a certain ceremonial, a certain luxury.” (Georges Franju). Also available in French on 16mm film.

Credits: Director, Georges Franju ; writers, Jacques Champreux, Francis Lacassin ; photography, Marcel Fradetal ; music, Maurice Jarre ; editor, Gilbert Natot.
Cast: Channing Pollock, Francine Berge, Sylvia Koscina, Edith Scob, Michel Vitold.

Judex’ is a homage to Louis Feuillade’s twelve episode serial made in 1916. The characters - the evil banker, his innocent daughter, Judex the invisible avenger, the comic detective, the adventuress and the beautiful acrobat - are derived directly from the serial and full of improbable twists and turns. The magical clash between good and evil provides the pretext for poetic symbolism and surreal set pieces such as the murder at the masked ball, filmed in the contrasty black and white photography of early cinema. On the surface Franju’s film seems to foreshadow postmodern pastiche but the difference lies in the gap between the random stylistic allusion of the latter and Franju’s loving immersion in the ‘surreal innocence’ of an earlier time. ‘Judex’ will be a physical film, not a psychological film. Forget fiction. I want to make a dream-like, purely formal film; I am looking for a certain ceremonial, a certain luxury.” (Georges Franju). Also available in French on 16mm film.

Credits: Director, Georges Franju ; writers, Jacques Champreux, Francis Lacassin ; photography, Marcel Fradetal ; music, Maurice Jarre ; editor, Gilbert Natot.
Cast: Channing Pollock, Francine Berge, Sylvia Koscina, Edith Scob, Michel Vitold.

results.title: Jude the Obscure
results.creator_credit: BBC, Martin Lismore and Hugh David
results.brief_description: A television adaptation of Thomas Hardy’s novel which tells the story of the doomed Jude Fawley, a bright but poor stonemason. Trapped into marriage with Bella he is unable to realise his ambitions of education at Christminster. When Bella leaves him for Australia he meets his cousin Sue with whom he begins a long and tortuous relationship with tragic consequences, seeming to realise his aunt’s belief that marriage and the Fawley’s are not a possible combination. Stars Robert Powell, Alex Marshall and Fiona Walker.

results.title: Jude's case (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Jude is a conscientious researcher in a professional market research team. Her supervisor wants her to be more creative and she is shocked and resentful at his feedback. Peter Quarry assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.

results.title: Jude
results.creator_credit: Revolution Films, Andrew Eaton and Michael Winterbottom
results.brief_description: Jude Fawley is a stonemason who loves learning. Inspired by his childhood schoolmaster, he longs to attend university and singlemindedly studies in the hope of gaining a place. His studies are interrupted when Jude blindly falls for and marries Arabella Dunn, the daughter of a local pig farmer. After a brief and unhappy marriage he moves to Christminster to be closer to his beloved scholars. There he meets and falls fatally in love with his cousin Sue Bridehead. The ill-fated lovers join in an illicit union that flouts society’s conventions and tragedy ensues. Based on the novel “Jude the obscure” by Thomas Hardy.

results.title: Judaism: the religion of a people
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Religions of the world”.
The religious practices and laws of Judaism have been handed down intact over many milleniums. This program looks at the foundations of Jewish teaching and laws as well as giving insight into the history of the Jewish people and their struggle to keep their identity and homeland.
